title: Słociński, Adam M.
text:
RESEARCHER | DEVELOPER
As a researcher, I explore the intersection of technology, ethics, and social science, with a particular focus on the responsible application of machine learning across diverse contexts. My work focuses on developing open, accessible, and automated reporting systems for public sector organizations. I am passionate about ensuring that technology serves the public good and enhances transparency and accountability. Through my research and development efforts, I aim to contribute to a future where technology and ethics coexist harmoniously, fostering innovation that is both responsible and inclusive.

LANGUAGES







Culturally adept


#| label: fig-languages
#| fig-cap: "Languages sorted by proficiency, highest to lowest"

import altair as alt
import pandas as pd

# Data with updated strength values
data = {
    'languages': ['English', 'French', 'Polish', 'Indonesian'],
    'strength': [4, 3, 2.5, 1]  # Updated values
}

# Create a DataFrame
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

# Sort the DataFrame by 'strength' in descending order
df = df.sort_values(by='strength', ascending=True)

# Create the Altair chart
chart = alt.Chart(df).mark_bar(
    color='navy',
    size=20  # Adjust bar height
).encode(
    x=alt.X('strength:Q', 
            title=None,  # Remove x-axis title
            scale=alt.Scale(domain=[0, max(df['strength']) * 1.1])  # Add some padding
    ),
    y=alt.Y('languages:N', 
            title=None,  # Remove y-axis title
            sort='-x'  # Sort in descending order
    ),
    tooltip=['languages', 'strength']
).properties(
    width=640,  # Width in pixels
    height=180  # Height in pixels
).configure_view(
    strokeWidth=0  # Remove chart border
)

# Display the chart
chart
